snippet: The Heat held off a fourth-quarter rally by the Thunder as LeBron James scored 32 points and Miami claimed home-court advantage in the N.B.A. finals by winning Game 2.
abstract: Miami Heat defeat Oklahoma City Thunder, 100-96, to tie the NBA finals, 1-1; Heat forward LeBron James makes all 12 of his foul shots, finishing with 32 points.
lead_paragraph: The Heat held off a fourth-quarter rally by the Thunder as LeBron James scored 32 points and Miami claimed home-court advantage in the N.B.A. finals by winning Game 2.

headline.seo: N.B.A. Finals — Heat Beat Thunder in Game 2
headline.main: James Makes a Stand, and Delivers
